metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10918 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the way samba checked databaseoutputs from the LDB database layer. An authenticated attacker could usethis flaw to crash a samba server in an Active Directory Domain Controllerconfiguration. Samba versions before 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13').
